required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pregnenolone for Cognitive and Negative Symptoms in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: Pregnenolone for Cognitive and Negative Symptoms in Schizophrenia

lead_sponsor.agency: VA Office of Research and Development

clinical_study.source: VA Office of Research and Development

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate adjunctive pregnenolone for patients with schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
primary_outcome.description: The MATRICS Consensus Cognitive Battery (MCCB) is a standardized battery for use with adults with schizophrenia and related disorders to measure cognition in these individuals. The MCCB consists of ten individually administered test which measure speed of processing, attention/vigilance, nonverbal working memory, verbal working memory, verbal learning, visual learning, reasoning and problem solving and social cognition. The primary raw scores are entered into the MCCB Computer Scoring Program which then generates the corresponding T-scores and percentiles, along with a graphic profile of the scores for each of the seven cognitive domains. Higher scores indicate better performance.

primary_outcome.measure: University of California Performance-based Skills Assessment (UPSA)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
primary_outcome.description: The UCSD Performance-based Skills Assessment (UPSA) is a measure of Functional Capacity and assesses skills involved in community tasks. It is composed of five subdomains (comprehension and planning, finance, communication, mobility and house management) when combined, measures functional capacity. The comprehension and planning subdomain ranges from 0 to 14, the finance subdomain ranges from 0 to 11, the communication subdomain ranges from 0 to 12, the mobility subdomain ranges from 0 to 9, and the house management subdomain ranges from 0 to 4. Then a medication management score of 0 to 37 is added. In total, the Assessment is thus scored on a 0 to 87 scale, with higher scores indicating better performance.

primary_outcome.measure: Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
primary_outcome.description: The Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) captures those domains of cognition that are the most severely affected in patients with schizophrenia and the most strongly correlated with functional outcome. The domains of cognitive function assessed and the associated tests include: Verbal Memory & Learning (Verbal Memory), Working Memory (Digit Sequencing), Motor Function (Token Motor Task), Verbal Fluency (Semantic and Letter Fluency), Speed of Processing (Symbol Coding), and Executive Function (Tower of London). These domains are then converted to Z scores compared to standardized scoring scales, with higher scores representing better performance.

primary_outcome.measure: Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms(SANS)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
primary_outcome.description: The Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS) is an assessment used to obtain clinical ratings of negative symptoms in patients with schizophrenia. The SANS assesses five symptom complexes. They are: affective blunting; alogia (impoverished thinking); avolition/apathy; anhedonia/asociality; and disturbance of attention. 24 assessments are conducted on a six-point scale (0=not at all to 5=severe) each, for a total scoring range of 0-120. Lower scores represent better performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period.
secondary_outcome.description: The CDSS assesses the level of depression in schizophrenia by measuring nine items on a 0 (absent) to 3 (severe) scale each. Thus, the total score range is 0 to 27. Lower scores represent better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
secondary_outcome.description: The PANSS measures positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia through administering a structured interview. After the interview, 25 PANSS items are each rated 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme). These items are organized into five scales: Negative, Positive, Dysphoric Mood, Activation, and Autistic Preoccupation. The combination of the 25 items produces a total score range of 25-175, and lower scores represent better outcomes.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
secondary_outcome.description: The CGI scale provides a brief, stand-alone assessment of the clinician's view of the patient's global functioning prior to and after initiating a study medication. The CGI comprises two companion one-item measures evaluating the severity of psychopathology from 1 to 7 and change from the initiation of treatment on a similar seven-point scale. Thus, scores range from 2 to 14, with lower scores representing better outcomes.

intervention.description: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

overall_official.affiliation: Durham VA Medical Center, Durham, NC

facility.name: Durham VA Medical Center, Durham, NC

group.title: Arm 1: Pregnenolone
group.description: Dietary Supplement: Pregnenolone: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

group.title: Arm 1: Pregnenolone
group.description: Dietary Supplement: Pregnenolone: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.description: The CDSS assesses the level of depression in schizophrenia by measuring nine items on a 0 (absent) to 3 (severe) scale each. Thus, the total score range is 0 to 27. Lower scores represent better outcomes.
outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period.

measure.title: The Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS)
measure.description: The CDSS assesses the level of depression in schizophrenia by measuring nine items on a 0 (absent) to 3 (severe) scale each. Thus, the total score range is 0 to 27. Lower scores represent better outcomes.

outcome.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS)
outcome.description: The PANSS measures positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia through administering a structured interview. After the interview, 25 PANSS items are each rated 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme). These items are organized into five scales: Negative, Positive, Dysphoric Mood, Activation, and Autistic Preoccupation. The combination of the 25 items produces a total score range of 25-175, and lower scores represent better outcomes.
outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)

group.title: Arm 1: Pregnenolone
group.description: Dietary Supplement: Pregnenolone: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

measure.title: Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS)
measure.description: The PANSS measures positive and negative symptoms of schizophrenia through administering a structured interview. After the interview, 25 PANSS items are each rated 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme). These items are organized into five scales: Negative, Positive, Dysphoric Mood, Activation, and Autistic Preoccupation. The combination of the 25 items produces a total score range of 25-175, and lower scores represent better outcomes.

outcome.title: Clinical Global Impressions (CGI) Scale
outcome.description: The CGI scale provides a brief, stand-alone assessment of the clinician's view of the patient's global functioning prior to and after initiating a study medication. The CGI comprises two companion one-item measures evaluating the severity of psychopathology from 1 to 7 and change from the initiation of treatment on a similar seven-point scale. Thus, scores range from 2 to 14, with lower scores representing better outcomes.
outcome.time_frame: Prospective, outcome measures collected over 10 week trial period. (Weeks 2, 6 and 10)
outcome.population: Missing data for a total of 5 participants for the CGI.

group.title: Arm 1: Pregnenolone
group.description: Dietary Supplement: Pregnenolone: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

measure.title: Clinical Global Impressions (CGI) Scale
measure.description: The CGI scale provides a brief, stand-alone assessment of the clinician's view of the patient's global functioning prior to and after initiating a study medication. The CGI comprises two companion one-item measures evaluating the severity of psychopathology from 1 to 7 and change from the initiation of treatment on a similar seven-point scale. Thus, scores range from 2 to 14, with lower scores representing better outcomes.
measure.population: Missing data for a total of 5 participants for the CGI.

group.title: Arm 1: Pregnenolone
group.description: Pregnenolone Dietary Supplement: Pregnenolone: Pregnenolone 50mg BID x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 150 x 14 days, followed by Pregnenolone 250 mg BID x thereafter for the remainder of the 8-week trial.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
